text: [UPBEAT MUSIC]

Without the Live
Online Classroom,

I really would not have
had the opportunity

to invite everybody
from my childhood all

the way to graduate
school to my concert.
My name is Madeline Meehan.

I'm the director of Campus
Activation, HBS Connects.

What I do is build
communities and try

to weave together faculty,
staff, students, and alumni.

It's so important
to bring together

these communities
in different ways,

be it activating spaces on
campus or building community
virtually.
My name is Lisa.

I am a second-year MBA
student at Harvard.

I was originally just thinking
about presenting a recital

for the audience, but
because of the structure

of the live online classroom,
I had this opportunity

to merge the narratives that
I had with classical music
with a piano recital.

Just by a show of
hands, how many of you
grew up playing classical music?
Okay.
That's a lot of you.

It was so neat to see
people raising their hand
and showing reaction.

It really felt like
everybody was in the room.

It was because of the
format and the technology

that really enabled me to put
together such a unique concert.

Sharing my stories
in music and telling

everybody what music means to
me-- it was really special.

There was the lighting, sound
engineering, the control room.

And it was really
pushing the envelope

of what we traditionally see and
perceive to be performing arts.
